title: Recent update broke my browser

title: Conflict between Firefox and Thunderbird - FF side
content:
When FF is open and then I open TB, several new windows are created in FF. My default FF window disappears and is not present in the windows history. When I reset my computer, sometimes my default FF window reappears. When I do something in FF, TB immediately closes.

At first I suspected TB and put a question in the TB forum. I downgraded TB from 128.2.3 to 115.10.1 after disabling automatic updates of TB. Initially the problem seemed solved, but not so.

I am surprised the FF and TB seem to influence one another.

Working with FF 130.0.1.
creator: chris.vanderstraeten

title: La scrittura dei dati di profilo presenta numerosi malfunzionamenti
content: Buongiorno abbiamo circa un centinaio di client che utilizzano thunderbird 64bit aggiornato ultima versione. I client sono win10 e win11 Ultimamente abbiamo grossi problemi nella scrittura sulle cartelle profilo e questo si realizza in visualizzazione delle mail errate (messaggio bianco oppure non sincronizzato correttamente), modifiche agli account o nelle impostazioni che si perdono dopo il riavvio di thunderbird. Questo sta succedendo ultimamente con grande frequenza. Sapete se ci sono soluzioni? Grazie mille

title: Protonmail products not working on Firefox
content:
Hello,

since recently, I can't login to any of Protonmail products. Going to their website gives me 400 bad request (Your browser sent a request that this server could not understand. Size of a request header field exceeds server limit.). I also can't log in to their Firefox extentions anymore. It used to work before without any problems. And I don't have any problems on other browsers, so I assume it has to have something to do with Firefox. I tried to clear the cache and reinstall Firefox, but it doesn't help. Any idea about how can I fix this? Thank you!

title: Firefox for macOS opens right-click menu when pressing control+return
content: I recently reloaded my M1 MacBook Air with macOS Sequoia. Ever since doing so, Firefox opens the right-click menu every time I press Control+Return (like when attempting to autocomplete a URL ending in .com, a feature I use quite frequently). It is only in Firefox that this happens, no other browser or program is doing this. I have uninstalled Firefox using AppCleaner, downloaded a new copy of Firefox 131.0 and reinstalled without any change in this behavior. Any ideas on what I can do to stop this so Control+Return only autocompletes a URL again?

title: Youtube videos not saving to 'Watch Later' in Firefox, fine on Safari
content:
Hi there,

For the last week or so, when I watch Youtube on Firefox, I can't save a video to Watch Later or any other way, and I can't even open the pop-downs to edit my lists. I'm signed in, my ad blockers are off for Youtube, I'm doing everything the same way I've always done it. Thought it was just a brief glitch, but since it continues, I tried the same on the Safari browser today, and had no problems.

There is an error message sometimes; I've added it via screen image.

Can you help me figure out if this is a setting I can easily fix, or requires a fix on your end?

Thank you!

title: Unremovable "List all tabs" Button
content:
I want to get rid of the "List all tabs" button that has appeared in Firefox 131.0! WTF are these cretinous devs thinking in not providing an option to delete this? One of the hallmarks of Firefox has always been customizability. Apparently, the devs need to be reminded of this! I hate this feature with a passion and want it gone NOW! It is a detestable eyesore on my, otherwise, pristine interface which constantly draws my eye and incites anger. Acceptable solutions include making it possible to drag it off the toolbar using the "customize toolbar" feature, allowing users to right click it and click "remove from toolbar", or allowing it to be removed using about:config.

Why would the devs alienate a significant portion of their user base by insisting that this be on the toolbar? Are they so out of touch? The devs need to wake the F up! Many users do not habitually keep a large number of tabs open and do not want or need this feature taking up real estate on the toolbar! Having options is a good thing. Making the "List all tabs" feature available to those who want it is commendable; shoving it down everyone’s throats whether they want it or not is deplorable.
creator: choninhw
